Content: Minister of Ports, Shipping and Southern Development Sagala Ratnayake has taken steps to sort out the issues concerning the whale watching operation. A special meeting to discuss the issues prevailing in this process was held at the auditorium of the Ministry of Ports and Shipping and Southern Development under the aegis of Minister Sagala Ratnayake. Attention was directed to taking the necessary initiatives for the crafting of a formal strategy identifying the weaknesses in boat services transporting local as well as foreign tourists. The Minister said that viewing process of whales should be utilized to strengthen the economy. Minister Sagala Ratnayake stressed the importance of maintaining the business without causing hindrance to the whales. The Minister proposed the awarding of standards certificates to boat owners. Another proposal made was to implement a programme for the granting of loan facilities to boat owners. Nearly 2000 tourists arrive at Mirissa daily to view whales.
